title: Game Architecture & State
overview: Prevent spaghetti code by managing Game States effectively.
objectives: Implement Menu, Playing, and Game Over states

sections.title: State Management
sections.content:
Games usually track a high-level state string or enum:
- `menu`
- `playing`
- `paused`
- `gameover`

Your loop should switch logic based on this state.

questions.question: Why use a State Machine?
options: To cleanly separate logic (e.g., don't move player while in menu)
It is required by the browser
questions.correctAnswer: To cleanly separate logic (e.g., don't move player while in menu)
questions.explanation: State machines prevent logic collisions, like shooting weapons while the game is paused.

questions.question: Where should the state check happen?
options: In both update and render loops
questions.correctAnswer: In both update and render loops

miniProject.title: State Flow
miniProject.description: Add a Start Screen and Game Over screen to your game.
steps: If state is 'menu', draw text 'Press Enter to Start'
If 'gameover', show score and 'Press R to Restart'
rubric: Can cycle through Menu -> Game -> End -> Menu
